intro: Erophila furcipila, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms during the warmer months. Erophila furcipila is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ease of cultivation.
